event.descr:
Notification of a communication error with Point Code. This shows which component had failed, the fault type and severity level and the time it occurred from the MIB-II restart time. Because many of the failures need to be described in detail for troubleshooting, an alarm log is written with supplemental information. The trap and log are correlated based on the alarm time.

tpAlarmId %parm[#1]%;

tpAlarmCatId %parm[#2]%;

tpAlarmCatName %parm[#3]%;

tpAlarmCatDesc %parm[#4]%;

tpAlarmSet %parm[#5]%;

clear(1) set(2)

tpAlarmNotify %parm[#6]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpAlarmSeverity %parm[#7]%;

informational(1) minor(2) major(3) critical(4)

tpAlarmReported %parm[#8]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpComponentId %parm[#9]%;

tpComponentType %parm[#10]%;

tpCompMMLName %parm[#11]%;

tpCompDesc %parm[#12]%;

tpCompParentId %parm[#13]%;

tpAlarmTime %parm[#14]%;
event.logmsg: commAlarm trap received tpAlarmId=%parm[#1]% tpAlarmCatId=%parm[#2]% tpAlarmCatName=%parm[#3]% tpAlarmCatDesc=%parm[#4]% tpAlarmSet=%parm[#5]% tpAlarmNotify=%parm[#6]% tpAlarmSeverity=%parm[#7]% tpAlarmReported=%parm[#8]% tpComponentId=%parm[#9]% tpComponentType=%parm[#10]% tpCompMMLName=%parm[#11]% tpCompDesc=%parm[#12]% tpCompParentId=%parm[#13]% tpAlarmTime=%parm[#14]%

event.descr:
Notification when there is a failure in the quality of service. This shows which component had failed, its operational status, fault type and severity level and the time it occurred from the MIB-II restart time. Because many of the failures need to be described in detail for troubleshooting, an alarm log is written with supplemental information. The trap and log are correlated based on the alarm time.

tpAlarmCatId %parm[#2]%;

tpAlarmCatName %parm[#3]%;

tpAlarmCatDesc %parm[#4]%;

tpAlarmSet %parm[#5]%;

clear(1) set(2)

tpAlarmNotify %parm[#6]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpAlarmSeverity %parm[#7]%;

informational(1) minor(2) major(3) critical(4)

tpAlarmReported %parm[#8]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpComponentId %parm[#9]%;

tpComponentType %parm[#10]%;

tpCompMMLName %parm[#11]%;

tpCompDesc %parm[#12]%;

tpCompParentId %parm[#13]%;

tpAlarmTime %parm[#14]%;

tpAlarmCatName %parm[#3]%;

tpAlarmCatDesc %parm[#4]%;

tpAlarmSet %parm[#5]%;

clear(1) set(2)

tpAlarmNotify %parm[#6]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpAlarmSeverity %parm[#7]%;

informational(1) minor(2) major(3) critical(4)

tpAlarmReported %parm[#8]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpComponentId %parm[#9]%;

tpComponentType %parm[#10]%;

tpCompMMLName %parm[#11]%;

tpCompDesc %parm[#12]%;

tpCompParentId %parm[#13]%;

tpAlarmTime %parm[#14]%;
event.logmsg: equipmentError trap received tpAlarmId=%parm[#1]% tpAlarmCatId=%parm[#2]% tpAlarmCatName=%parm[#3]% tpAlarmCatDesc=%parm[#4]% tpAlarmSet=%parm[#5]% tpAlarmNotify=%parm[#6]% tpAlarmSeverity=%parm[#7]% tpAlarmReported=%parm[#8]% tpComponentId=%parm[#9]% tpComponentType=%parm[#10]% tpCompMMLName=%parm[#11]% tpCompDesc=%parm[#12]% tpCompParentId=%parm[#13]% tpAlarmTime=%parm[#14]%

event.descr:
Notification of an TransPath system.s environment problem. This shows which component had failed, its operational status, fault type and severity level and the time it occurred from the MIB-II restart time. Because many of the failures need to be described in detail for troubleshooting, an alarm log is written with supplemental information. The trap and log are correlated based on the alarm time.

tpAlarmId %parm[#1]%;

tpAlarmCatId %parm[#2]%;

tpAlarmCatName %parm[#3]%;

tpAlarmCatDesc %parm[#4]%;

tpAlarmSet %parm[#5]%;

clear(1) set(2)

tpAlarmNotify %parm[#6]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpAlarmSeverity %parm[#7]%;

informational(1) minor(2) major(3) critical(4)

tpAlarmReported %parm[#8]%;

no(1) yes(2)

tpComponentId %parm[#9]%;

tpComponentType %parm[#10]%;

tpCompMMLName %parm[#11]%;

tpCompDesc %parm[#12]%;

tpCompParentId %parm[#13]%;

tpAlarmTime %parm[#14]%;
